page.title: 02FARMS AROUND DIDCOT
page.content: There are five active farms in our Block. Willington Down Farm has been owned by Mr Hockley since 1980. Mr Hedges of nearby Fulscot Manor used to own it. There are 600 acres of land at Willington Down, of which 400 are grown for wheat to make bread, 100 are grown for barley and 100 for oil seed rape, which is used for cooking oil and margarine. The crops are harvested in August. Two men work on the farm in Winter and three in Summer. The oldest barn on the farm is 200 years old. Every two years they have to buy new transport, which costs about 36,000 pounds. Ladygrove Farm is owned by Mr and Mrs Hiskins. It is not actually farmed anymore, although Mr Hiskins does grow grass for hay. He still has the pig sties, where the hay is stored.
